title: Globetrotters add Harrisburg native Jackson
text:
Globetrotters add Harrisburg native Jackson 
Updated: 
Posted by: Jason Bristol 
HARRISBURG, Pa. -- The Harlem Globetrotters are adding an ace. 
Crissa “Ace” Jackson, who played for Harrisburg High School, is joining the world-famous basketball team. She is the 13th female player in the history of the Globetrotters, according to a news release. 
Jackson played her first two years of college ball at Savannah State University (Ga.), where she led the team in scoring and assists as a sophomore and was named to the NCAA Division I All-Independent All-American second team. 
The 5'4" Jackson later moved to Point Loma Nazarene University (Calif.) for her final two seasons, leading the team in points, three-pointers and assists as a junior and in three-pointers, assists and steals as a senior. 
She is the second Harrisburg native to now play for the Globetrotters; joining Susquehanna Township grad Chris "Handles" Franklin. 
The Globetrotters will play over 330 games in more than 260 cities in 48 U.S. states, eight Canadian provinces and Puerto Rico from December 26, 2015, through April 2016. 
The team says Jackson and the other new rookies attended the Globetrotters annual training camp in New York. 
Photo: Globetrotters/CBS 21 News
